name: National Historical Museum
description: This museum offers an in-depth view of Chile's history, from pre-Columbian times to the present, with a rich collection of historical artifacts.

name: Metropolitan Park of Santiago
description: A natural space ideal for hiking, cycling, and picnicking, with stunning views of the city and the Andes Mountains.

name: La Moneda Palace
address: Plaza de la Constitución 1, Santiago, Chile
description: The seat of the Chilean government and an important historical monument that hosts events and official ceremonies. Visitors can learn about the country's politics and history.

name: Paseo Ahumada
description: A bustling open-air shopping center in the heart of Santiago, filled with shops, restaurants, and a rich urban culture.

name: Central Market
description: A traditional market where visitors can enjoy the freshest seafood and experience local Chilean culture in a vibrant atmosphere.

name: Bellavista Neighborhood
description: Santiago's bohemian neighborhood, known for its nightlife, street art, and a wide variety of restaurants and bars. It's a popular spot to enjoy local culture.

name: Santa Lucia Hill
description: A park and hill in downtown Santiago, famous for its panoramic views of the city and its history, featuring monuments and trails to explore.

name: Municipal Theatre of Santiago
description: The city's main theater, offering a cultural program of opera, ballet, and classical music, considered one of the country's top artistic venues.
